limit.description: The maximum number of records to retrieve

offset.description: The number of records to skip before starting to retrieve data

functionality: Retrieve account records
example_code:
import requests
url = 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/now/account'
params = {'limit': {limit}, 'offset': {offset}, 'query': {query}}
headers = {'Accept': 'application/json'}
response = requests.get(url, params=params, headers=headers)
data = response.json()
print(data)

api_call: servicenow.retrieve_activities(before={before}, context={context}, context_instance={context_instance}, end_date={end_date}, facets={facets}, last={last}, record_id={record_id}, start_date={start_date}, stFrom={stFrom})

before.description: Date/time value. The request returns only records created prior to this date and time.

context.description: Required. Sys_id of an activity context. Located in the Activity Context [sn_actsub_activity_context] table. Predefined activity contexts include Consumer and Contact.

context_instance.description: Required. Sys_id of an instance of the specified activity context, representing the initiator of the activities you want to retrieve. Located in the appropriate table for the activity context.

end_date.description: Date/time value. The request returns only records created during the time period defined by start_date and this parameter. Must be set along with start_date.

facets.description: Comma-separated list of sys_ids of activity facet types to retrieve for the specified activity context. These sys_ids are located in the Activity Facet [sn_actsub_facet] table. Default: Return all activity facet types configured for the activity context.

last.description: Index value of the first result row omitted from the response body. The result row index starts at 0. Default: The value of the com.snc.actsub.activities.api.fetch.limit system property (10 by default).

record_id.description: Sys_id of a record to use when rendering dynamic facets. Located in the appropriate table for the activity type you want to retrieve.

start_date.description: Date/time value. The request returns only records created during the time period defined by this parameter and end_date. Must be set along with end_date.

stFrom.description: Index value of the first result row to include in the response body. The result row index starts at 0. Default: 0.

sysparm_limit.description: Maximum number of records to return. Unusually large sysparm_limit values can impact system performance. For requests that exceed this number of records, use the sysparm_offset parameter to paginate record retrieval.

sysparm_offset.description: Starting record index for which to begin retrieving records. Use this value to paginate record retrieval. This functionality enables the retrieval of all records, regardless of the number of records, in small manageable chunks.

sysparm_query.description: Encoded query used to filter the result set. Queries defined using this parameter are appended to any encoded queries produced by reference qualifiers.

sysparm_reference_field_columns.description: Comma-separated list of column names, from the table of the specified reference field, to return in the response.

sysparm_ref_qual_input.description: Encoded set of field values representing a current object to pass to reference qualifiers that use JavaScript functions. Use only when requesting a reference field.

account.description: Sys_id of the account associated with the case; located in the Account [customer_account] table.
account.default: If contact specified, defaults to account specified in contact record.

active.description: Flag that indicates whether the case is open and active.

active_escalation.description: Sys_id of the active escalation record associated with the case. Located in the Escalation [sn_customerservice_escalation] table.

activity_due.description: Date for which the associated case is expected to be completed.

additional_assignee_list.description: List of the sys_ids of the additional persons (other than the primary assignee) that have been assigned to the account. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

approval.description: String that describes the type of approval required.

assigned_to.description: Sys_id of the person assigned to the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

assignment_group.description: Sys_id of the customer service agent group assigned to the case. Located in the Group [sys_user_group] table.

business_duration.description: Length in calendar work hours, work days, and work weeks that it took to complete the case.

business_impact.description: Impact of the issue on the associated customer.

business_service.description: Sys_id of the service record associated with the case. Located in the Service [cmdb_ci_service] table.

cause.description: Details about the cause of the problem.

caused_by.description: Sys_id of the change request that caused the case to be created. Located in the Change Request [change_request] table.

change.description: Sys_id of the change request that caused the case to be created. Located in the Change Request [change_request] table.

child_case_creation_progress.description: Flag that indicates whether the case is a child case that was created from a major case.

close_notes.description: Notes made when the case was closed.

closed_at.description: Date and time that the case was closed.

closed_by.description: Sys_id of the user that closed the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

cmdb_ci.description: Sys_id of the configuration item associated with the case. Located in the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

company.description: Sys_id of the company associated with the case. Located in the Company [core_company] table.

consumer.description: Business-to-consumer cases only. Sys_id of the person to contact with regard to this case. Located in the Consumer [csm_consumer] table.

contact.description: Business-to-business based cases only. Sys_id of the person to contact regarding this case. Located in the Contact [customer_contact] table.

contact_time_zone.description: Time zone of the contact associated with the case.

contact_type.description: Method in which the case was initially reported.

contract.description: Sys_id of the contract associated with the case. Located in the Contract [ast_contract] table.

delivery_plan.description: Sys_id of the parent execution plan for this case. Located in the Execution Plan [sc_cat_item_delivery_plan] table.

delivery_task.description: Sys_id of the execution plan task. Located in the Execution Plan Task [sc_cat_item_delivery_task] table.

description.description: Detailed description of the problem associated with the case.

due_date.description: Date that the case is due to be closed.

entitlement.description: Sys_id of the entitlement record associated with the case. Located in the Entitlement [service_entitlement] table.

expected_start.description: Date and time when work is scheduled to begin on the case.

first_response_time.description: Date and time when the first action was taken on the case.

follow_the_sun.description: Flag that indicates whether the case should be handed-off for global follow-up.

group_list.description: List of sys_ids of the group records associated with the case. Located in the Group [sys_user_group] table.

knowledge.description: Flag that indicates if there is a knowledge base article available for the specified issue.

location.description: Sys_id of the record describing the company location. Located in the Location [cmn_location] table.

made_sla.description: Flag that indicates whether the case was resolved in alignment with the associated service level agreement.

major_case_state.description: Current state of the major case.

notes_to_comments.description: Flag that indicates whether to add the resolution notes to the comments.

notify.description: Method to use to notify contact/consumer.

opened_at.description: Date and time that the case was opened.

opened_by.description: Sys_id of the person that initially opened the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

parent.description: Sys_id of the parent case to which this case (child) is associated. Located in the Task [task] table.

partner.description: Sys_id of the partner associated with the case. Located in the Account [customer_account] table.

partner_contact.description: Sys_id of the partner contact associated with the case. Located in the Contact [customer_contact] table.

probable_cause.description: Possible cause of the issue associated with the case.

problem.description: Sys_id of the issue that the customer is encountering. Located in the Problem [problem] table.

product.description: Sys_id of the product model of the asset associated to the case. Located in the Product Model [cmdb_model] table.

reassignment_count.description: Number of times that the case was reassigned to a person that is responsible for moving the case forward.

recipient_list.description: Sys_id of the record that contains the list of recipients for communications about this case. Located in the Recipients List [sn_publications_recipients_list] table.

rejection_goto.description: Sys_id of the task to execute if the case is rejected. Located in the Task [task] table.

resolution_code.description: Resolution state for the case, such as 'Solved - Fixed by Support/Guidance provided'.

resolved_at.description: Date and time that the case was resolved.

resolved_by.description: Sys_id of the person that resolved the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

skills.description: List of the unique identifiers (sys_id) of the skills needed to complete the case. Located in the Skill [cmn_skill] table.

sla_due.description: Date/time at which the case must be closed based on the associated service level agreement.

social_channel.description: Type of social media channel such as Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.

social_handle_type.description: Type of case to associate the social media profile.

social_handle_url.description: URL of the user's social media handle.

social_post_url.description: URL of the social message from which the case is being generated.

support_manager.description: Sys_id of the CSM manager assigned to the case. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

sync_driver.description: Flag that indicates whether there's driver synchronization.

time_worked.description: Total amount of time worked on the case.

upon_approval.description: Action to take if the case is approved.

upon_reject.description: Action to take if the case is rejected.

variables.description: Name-value pairs of variables associated with the case.

watch_list.description: List of sys_ids of the users who receive notifications about this case when additional comments are added or if the state of a case is changed to Resolved or Closed. Located in the User [sys_user] table.

wf_activity.description: Sys_id of the workflow activity record associated with the case. Located in the Workflow Activity [wf_activity] table.

work_end.description: Date and time that work on the case ended.

work_notes_list.description: List of sys_ids of the work notes associated with the case. Located in the Work Note [sn_work_note] table.

work_start.description: Date and time that work on the case began.

functionality: Enables you to create and manage shared libraries and shared components by uploading configuration data.

api_version.description: Version of the endpoint to access

shared_library_name.description: Name of the shared library to create or manage. Located in the CDM Application [sn_cdm_application] table.

changeset_number.description: String that uniquely identifies the changeset associated with the application, such as Chset-102. Located in the CDM Changeset [sn_cdm_changeset] table. This changeset must be in the 'Open' state.

auto_commit.description: Flag that indicates whether the changeset identified in the changesetNumber parameter is committed to the data model after upload.

auto_delete.description: Flag that indicates whether the existing nodes, that aren’t part of the upload content, are deleted after the processing is complete.

delete_redundant_overrides.description: Flag that indicates whether to create an override where redundant values are present.

identifier_keys.description: List of names that indicate which key in an array child to use to identify the same node.

ignore_attributes.description: Flag that indicates whether the given data format supports attributes (currently only XML).

name_path.description: Path of the targeted node under which the configuration data should be uploaded.

publish_option.description: Publish option for the associated configured snapshots.

upload_data.description: Configuration data to upload. This can be any data in the format defined by the dataFormat parameter of the query parameters.

questions: What happens if the autoCommit parameter is set to true?
Can I upload configuration data in a format other than those listed in dataFormat?
How can I handle errors related to exceeding the maximum upload size?

functionality: Uploads files as part of the Configuration Data Model (CDM) under the components folder in a shared library.

api_version.description: Version of the endpoint to access

shared_library_name.description: Name of the shared library where the component to delete is located. Located in the CDM Application [sn_cdm_application] table.

changeset_number.description: String that uniquely identifies the changeset associated with the application, such as Chset-102. This changeset must be in the 'Open' state. Located in the CDM Changeset [sn_cdm_changeset] table.

auto_commit.description: Flag that indicates whether the changeset identified in the changesetNumber parameter is committed to the data model after upload.

auto_validate.description: Flag that indicates whether the snapshots created when committed are validated. Note: This option is only available if the autoCommit parameter is true.

file_name.description: Name of the file to upload. This name can differ from than the actual file name and contain the file extension.

file_node_name.description: Name of the file node. This file name is used in the configuration data when exporting it. This name doesn’t require a file extension nor does it affect the download.

name_path.description: Path of the targeted node under which the configuration data should be uploaded. This path is relative to the components, collection, or deployable folder (depending on the endpoint being called).

name.description: Required. ServiceNow user ID of the user making the endpoint request. Located in the User [sys_user] table. This user must have the devops.integration.user role. Starting with version 1.34.1, this user must have the sn_devops.admin role.

password.description: Required. Password of the user specified in the credenitals.name parameter.

pipelines.description: Array of objects that define pipelines to associate with applications.

app.description: Required if a pipelines object is specified. Name of the application to associate with the plan specified in the pipelines.name parameter. The application must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if a pipelines object is specified. Name of the pipeline to associate with the application specified in pipelines.app parameter. This pipeline must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if a pipelines object is specified. Tool to associate with the pipeline to create a unique pipeline/tool identifier.

changeSteps.description: Array of objects that define the change steps to create for the pipeline specified in the pipelines.name field.

changeApprovalGroup.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Name of the change approval group to associate with the pipeline. Located in the Group [sys_user_group] table. This group must already exist on the ServiceNow instance.

changeControlledBranches.description: Comma-separated list of code branches that are under change control. This only applies for multi branch support.

changeType.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Type of change request to create. The available types are defined in the Type field of the Change Request [change_request] table.

name.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Name of the step to create. The step name must match the name of the corresponding step in the orchestration tool’s pipeline.

type.description: Required if a changeSteps object is specified. Type of step to create. The available step types are defined in the Type field of the Steps [sn_devops_step] table.

plans.description: Array of objects that define a plan to associate with an application.

app.description: Required if a plans object is specified. Names of applications to associate with the plan specified in the plans.name parameter. These applications must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if a plans object is specified. Name of the plan to associate with the application specified in plans.app parameter. This plan must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if a plans object is specified. Tool to associate with the plan to create a unique plan/tool identifier.

project.description: Required if a plans object is specified and the plans.tool supports projects entity (for example, the ADO tool). Tool to associate with the pipeline to create a unique plans/tool identifier. Parameter value must derive from a project in the Project [sn_devops_project] table.

repositories.description: Array of objects that define the repositories associated with an application. If the repositories object contains an app parameter, then it maps the repository to the application.

app.description: Required if a repositories object is specified. Name of the application to associate with this repository. The application must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if a repositories object is specified. Name of the repository to associate with the application specified in repositories.app parameter. This repository must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if a repositories object is specified. User friendly tool name to associate with the repository to create a unique repository/tool identifier. The tool must already be created on the ServiceNow instance.

project.description: Required if a repositories object is specified and the repositories.tool supports a projects entity (for example, the ADO tool). Tool to associate with the repositories to create a unique repository/tool identifier. Parameter value must derive from a project in the Project [sn_devops_project] table.

artifact_repositories.description: Array of objects that define artifact repositories associated with applications.

app.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified. Name of the application to associate with this artifactRepositories. The application must have already been created or be specified in the apps object of this request.

name.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified. Name of the artifactRepositories to associate with the application specified in artifactRepositories.app parameter. This artifactRepositories must already be discovered on the ServiceNow instance.

tool.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified. User friendly tool name to associate with the artifactRepositories to create a unique artifactRepositories /tool identifier. The tool must already be created on the ServiceNow instance.

project.description: Required if the artifactRepositories object is specified and the repositories.tool supports projects entity (for example, the ADO tool). Tool to associate with the artifactRepositories to create a unique pipeline/tool identifier.

functionality: Creates an onboarding app event that is asynchronously processed by the DevOps service.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

credentials.description: Required. Credentials to use for the webhook creation. The tool uses the created webhook to send notifications.

name.description: Required. ServiceNow identifier of the user making the endpoint request. Located in the User [sys_user] table. This user must have the devops.integration.user role. Starting with version 1.34.1, this user must have the sn_devops.admin role.

password.description: Required. Password of the user specified in the credenitals.name parameter.

tools.description: Required. Array of objects that define the tools to create within the associated ServiceNow instance. You can create one or more tools in a single request.

name.description: Required. User friendly name or label of the tool to create. This name is used to identify the tool in the DevOps service.

password.description: Required except for Agile tool. Password to use to access the tool. Supported authentications are basic and token; OAuth is not supported.

type.description: Required. Type of tool to create, such as GitHub or BitBucket. The specified value must be one of the Tool labels in the Tool Integrations [sn_devops_tool_integration] table.

useMidServer.description: Flag that indicates whether the tool connects through a MID Server. Valid values: true (Connects through a MID Server), false (Does not connect through a MID Server).

username.description: Required except for Agile tool. User name to use to access the tool through this endpoint.

url.description: Required except for Agile tool. URL of the tool to create. The DevOps service uses this URL to integrate with the tool.

functionality: Creates an onboarding tool event that is asynchronously processed by the DevOps service.
example_code: curl -X POST "https://servicenow-instance/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/onboarding/tool" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u "username":"password" -d '{"tools":[{"name": "Primary GitHub","type": "GitHub","url": "https://api.github.com","username": "username","password": "password","useMidServer": false }],"credentials" : {"name": "devops_user","password": "devops_password"}}'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the DevOps tool for which to place the specified task under change control. Located in the Orchestration Tool sn_devops_orchestration_tool table.

tool_type.description: Type of tool. Valid value: Any value that identifies the tool, such as 'jenkins'.

request_body.description: Request body parameters for registering a callback with a ServiceNow instance for an orchestration task under change control.

callbackURL.description: Required. URL that the ServiceNow instance can call back once the associated change request approval process is complete. This callback should let the pipeline execution continue or not, based on the approval result.

changeRequestDetails.description: Name-value pairs of the fields to set when closing a change request.

isMultiBranch.description: If the orchestration tool is Jenkins, flag that indicates whether the project is of type Multibranch.

triggerType.description: Required. The way the orchestration task was started.

upstreamTaskExecutionURL.description: Required if triggerType is set to upstream. Upstream task execution URL.

orchestrationTaskURL.description: Required. URL of the orchestration task for which to create the call back.

parentNode.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, this value contains the parent node details.

parentStageName.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the name of the parent orchestration task.

parentStageURL.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the URL of the parent orchestration task.

functionality: Registers a callback with a ServiceNow instance for an orchestration task under change control.
example_code: curl -X POST 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/orchestration/changeControl?toolId=f0ca45679323008b52f3b457415ae6&toolType=jenkins' -H 'accept: application/json' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -u 'username:password' -d '{"orchestrationTaskURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/orchestration task/Mobile-Platform-deploy/","callbackURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/sn-devops/964aca59-0cae-4d9b-a36d-5929f426cf31","orchestrationTaskDetails":{"message":"Started by upstream project \"Mobile-Platform-test\" build number 40","triggerType":"upstream","upstreamTaskExecutionURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/job/Mobile-Platform-test/40/"}}'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the orchestration tool. Located in the Orchestration Tool [sn_devops_orchestration_tool] table.

tool_type.description: Required. Type of tool. Valid values: jenkins

request_body.description: Request body parameters for verifying and creating an orchestration task.

branchName.description: Name of the branch associated with the orchestration task.

isMultiBranch.description: If the orchestration tool is Jenkins, flag that indicates whether the project is of type Multibranch.

parentNode.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, this value contains the parent node details.

parentStageName.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the name of the parent orchestration task.

parentStageURL.description: If the orchestration task is a child nested inside a parent orchestration task, the URL of the parent orchestration task.

orchestrationTaskName.description: Required. Name of the orchestration task. This is the same task referenced in the orchestrationTaskURL.

orchestrationTaskURL.description: Required. URL of the orchestration task.

functionality: Verifies that the information being passed is valid for the creation of an orchestration task and is valid for association to a previously created step. If both are valid, it creates the orchestration task and makes the association.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access. For example, v1 or v2. Only specify this value to use an endpoint version other than the latest.

orchestration_tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the orchestration tool associated with the artifact package. Located in the Orchestration Tool [sn_devops_orchestration_tool] table.

artifact_tool_id.description: Sys_id of the artifact tool associated with the artifact package. Located in the Artifact Tool [sn_devops_artifact_tool] table.

request_body.description: Request body parameters for registering an artifact package.

name.description: Required. Name of package.

artifacts.description: At least one entry required. Array of objects in which each object uniquely identifies an artifact version to include in the package.

branchName.description: Name of the branch associated with the artifact version.

name.description: Required. Artifact file name.

functionality: Enables orchestration tools to create new artifact packages that contain specified artifact versions.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

capability.description: Type of tool passing in the payload to store in the Inbound Event table.

tool_id.description: Required. Sys_id of the tool for which the endpoint is being called.

request_body.description: Request body parameters specific to the tool.

functionality: Posts the passed-in payload to the Inbound Event table for processing by a custom DevOps subflow.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

sn_tool_id.description: Sys_id of the tool to use for the request.

request_body.description: Request body parameters specific to the tool. The payload can be located in the tool under the webhook information.

functionality: Posts the passed-in payload from GitHub, Jira, or Bitbucket to the Events [sn_devops_event] table for processing by a pre-built subflow.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

changeControlId.description: Sys_id of the change control task.

toolId.description: Sys_id of the DevOps tool associated with the change control task.

request_body.description: Request body parameters for updating the change control task.

functionality: Updates the change control information for the specified orchestration task.
example_code: curl -X PUT 'https://instance.service-now.com/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/orchestration/change/f0ca45679323008b52f3b457415ae6?toolId=f0ca45679323008b52f3b457415ae6' -H 'accept: application/json' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -u 'username:password' -d '{"orchestrationTaskURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/job/Mobile-Platform-deploy/","toolType":"jenkins","callbackURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/sn-devops/964aca59-0cae-4d9b-a36d-5929f426cf31","orchestrationTaskDetails":{"message":"Started by upstream project \"Mobile-Platform-test\" build number 40","triggerType":"upstream","upstreamTaskExecutionURL":"https://jenkins.mycompany.com:8080/job/Mobile-Platform-test/40/"}}'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

changeInfo.description: The identifier for the change information.

changeRequestNumber.description: Change request number associated with the orchestration task to update.

request_body.description: Name-value pairs for the field(s) to update in the associated change request.

functionality: Updates fields in a specified change request.
example_code: curl -X PUT 'https://instance.servicenow.com/api/sn_devops/v1/devops/orchestration/changeInfo?changeRequestNumber=CHG0030023' -H 'accept: application/json' -u 'username:password' -d '{"short_description": "Test description", "priority": "1", "start_date": "2021-02-05 08:00:00", "end_date": "2022-04-05 08:00:00", "justification": "test justification", "description": "test description", "cab_required": true, "comments": "This update for work notes is from jenkins file", "work_notes": "test work notes", "assignment_group": "a715cd759f2002002920bde8132e7018" }'

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appid.description: Sys_id of the application to delete.

functionality: Deletes an application.
questions: What precautions should be taken before deleting an application?

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appid.description: Sys_id of the application to retrieve.

functionality: Retrieves an application.

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appid.description: Sys_id of the application to update.

appManagedByGroups.description: Comma-separated list of sys_ids of the groups that manage the application.

appModelOwnerId.description: Sys_id of the application model owner.

functionality: Updates an application.

api_call: servicenow.create_devops_application(api_version, appDescription, appManagedByGroups, appManufacturerId, appModelId, appModelName, appModelOwnerId, appName, appServiceId, appServiceName, technicalServiceId, type)

api_version.description: Optional. Version of the endpoint to access.

appManagedByGroups.description: Comma-separated list of sys_ids of the groups that manage the application.

appModelId.description: Sys_id of an existing application model to use to create the application.

appModelName.description: Name of an existing application model to use to create the application.

appModelOwnerId.description: Sys_id of the application model owner.

appName.description: Name of the application.

appServiceId.description: Sys_id of an existing application service to use to create the application.

appServiceName.description: Name of an existing application service to use to create the application.

technicalServiceId.description: Sys_id of an existing dynamic CI group to use to create the application.

type.description: The type of application to create.

functionality: Creates an application.
example_code: curl 'https://instance.service-now.com/api/sn_devops_config/devops_config/application' --request POST --header 'Accept:application/json' --header 'Content-Type:application/json' --data '{ "type": "application", "appName": "Demo Application 1234", "appDescription": "Description of Demo Application created from REST API", "appManufacturerId": "262702654725d950a34a3085d36d435e", "appModelOwnerId": "6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441" }' --user 'username':'password'
